estuary.model

Class ModelShoreGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • estuary.model.Game
      • estuary.model.ModelShoreGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable, GameFunctionality, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShoreTutorial

    public class ModelShoreGame
extends Game
    Contains all of the game logic for the Shore Game
    Version:
    12/6/16
    Author:
    Greg Palmer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelShoreGame

        public ModelShoreGame(int diff)
        A ModelShoreGame has lists of Oysters, ShoreThreats, Shores, OysterGabions, Waves, Seawalls and Barriers. It also has a set WIDTH and HEIGHT. It has one ShoreCrab at all times. The Oystercount starts at 0 and increases as the player collects Oysters. A shoregame also has a timer to keep track of when events should occur.
        Parameters:
        diff - used to determine how often shore threats and waves appear.

      • ModelShoreGame

        public ModelShoreGame(ShoreCrab shoreCrab,
                      java.util.List<Wave> waves,
                      java.util.List<ShoreThreat> shoreThreats,
                      java.util.List<Oyster> oysters,
                      java.util.List<Shore> shoreLine,
                      java.util.List<SeaWall> seaWalls,
                      java.util.List<OysterGabion> oysterGabions,
                      java.util.List<Barrier> borders,
                      int oysterCount)
        Takes in a list of all relevant game elements, to be called for testing purposes
        Parameters:
        shoreCrab -
        waves -
        shoreThreats -
        oysters -
        shoreLine -
        seaWalls -
        oysterGabions -
        borders -
        oysterCount -

    • Method Detail

      • initTimer

        public void initTimer()
        Initializes the timer

      • onTick

        public boolean onTick()
        onTick() handles all of the logic of the game from frame to frame and updates the game elements accordingly.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the game

      • isEnd

        public boolean isEnd()
        Determines if the game has ended or not. If any shore entity loses all of its health, the player loses and game is over. If a gabion is placed at every shore, the player wins and the game is over.
        Returns:
        a boolean of whether the game has ended or not

      • isShoreDead

        public boolean isShoreDead()
        Goes through each shore entity to see if any are at 0 health
        Returns:
        true if any shore has 0 health, otherwise false

      • isEndScreen

        public void isEndScreen()
        Checks to see if the game has reached its end state, and the end screen needs to be displayed

      • handleCollisions

        public void handleCollisions()
        handleCollsions() checks for all collisions that may have occurred and handles the logic of what happens.

      • spawnShoreThreat

        public void spawnShoreThreat()
        If it has been more than 20 seconds - difficulty since the last shorethreat was spawned, spawn a shorethreat. The shore threat is randomly chosen to start on the right or left

      • addNewShoreThreat

        public void addNewShoreThreat()
        Adds a new shore threat to the game

      • spawnOyster

        public void spawnOyster()
        If it has been more than 6 seconds since the last oyster was spawned, spawn an oyster. Its location is randomly chosen within the borders of the beach area.

      • addNewOyster

        public void addNewOyster()
        Creates an oyster

      • spawnGabion

        public OysterGabion spawnGabion(Shore shore)
        Creates an Oyster Gabion based on the location of a shore
        Parameters:
        shore - the shore the Gabion is being placed in front of
        Returns:
        The new oyster gabion

      • onGAction

        public void onGAction(boolean pressed)
        Handles the logic that occurs if the user presses the G key This key is used to create a gabion and place the gabion
        Parameters:
        pressed - boolean that is true if the button is pressed and false if it is released

      • onWAction

        public void onWAction(boolean pressed)
        Handles the logic that occurs if the user presses the W key This key is used to create a seawall
        Parameters:

        public void mousePressed(Vector2 mousePosition)
        Handles logic for when the mouse is pressed This is only used to exit the game when the endscreen is up
